metadata.description: Inventory - If Yes, will run a delay step to assist with the Dataverse health. Only turn to No for debugging.
Inventory - REQUIRED. Environment, including geographic location, for Power Automate - Ex for commercial: https://flow.microsoft.com/manage/environments/

Inventory - Have you set up data export in PPAC and is your inventory and telemetry in an Azure Data Storage folder (also referred to as Bring your own Datalake, self-serve analytics feature). Default no

Inventory - If true, (the default) the CoE inventory tracks all environments. New environments added to the inventory will have their Excuse from Inventory to false. You can opt out individual environments.  If false, the CoE inventory tracks a subset of environments. New environments added to the inventory will have their Excuse from Inventory to true. You can opt in individual environments.
in the maker table we store a user for system with an id. Storing here so that it can be referenced without having to look it up all the time.

parameters.item/admin_flowinstanceurl: @concat(parameters('Power Automate Environment Variable (admin_PowerAutomateEnvironmentVariable)'), workflow()?['tags']['environmentName'], '/flows/', workflow()?['name'], '/runs/', workflow()?['run']['name'])

Delay_1_to_300_minutes.description: For Dataverse service health, we will randomize the start time of these flows for tenants within a 5 hour range

equals: @parameters('Inventory and Telemetry in Azure Data Storage account (admin_InventoryandTelemetryinAzureDataStorageaccount)')

Catch_-_not_ready_to_take_last_run_date.inputs: Catch - not ready to take last run date

Default_Behavior_for_Excuse_from_Invento.inputs: @if(equals(parameters('is All Environments Inventory (admin_isFullTenantInventory)'), true), false, true)

For_Type_Legacy.description: Legacy and Default environments have the same GUID, prefixed by Legacy- or Default- which is causing issues as the Record Identifier is using the GUID as a unique identifier. We are therefore using a generated GUID for the entity.

Name_Length.description: Returns the index where the GUID starts

Remove_any_Environment_prefix.description: Returns the GUID without any prefix (right 36 chars)

IsOrphan.inputs: @if(or(equals(outputs('OwnerID'), null), equals(length(outputs('OwnerID')), 0), equals(outputs('Get_Maker')?['body/admin_makerisorphaned'], true), equals(outputs('Get_Maker')?['body/admin_makerid'], null)), true, false)

OwnerID.inputs: @if(equals(items('Apply_to_each_Environment')?['properties/createdBy/id'], null), if(equals(items('Apply_to_each_Environment')?['properties/createdBy/type'], 'NotSpecified'), parameters('CoE System User ID (admin_CoESystemUserID)'), ''), if(equals(items('Apply_to_each_Environment')?['properties/createdBy/id'], 'SYSTEM'), parameters('CoE System User ID (admin_CoESystemUserID)'), items('Apply_to_each_Environment')?['properties/createdBy/id']))

no_op_for_pre-existing_environments_excu.inputs: no op for pre-existing environments excused from inventory

See_if_need_to_add_to_inventory.description: inventory all envts not excused from inventory and all new envts so they can be updated with that setting. Hence [[ @outputs('is_New_Envt') = true OR @outputs('Excused_From_Inventory') = false ]]

catch_-_envt_deleted_since_flow_started.inputs: catch - envt deleted since flow started
